name: Edmund Husserl
alma_mater: Leipzig University, Humboldt University of Berlin
influences: Franz Brentano, Carl Stumpf, Karl Weierstrass, Bernard Bolzano, René Descartes, Immanuel Kant, David Hume, Hermann Lotze, Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz, Plato
influenced: Max Scheler, Martin Heidegger, Adolf Reinach, Edith Stein, Emmanuel Levinas, Jean-Paul Sartre, Maurice Merleau-Ponty, Alfred Schutz, Roman Ingarden, Paul Ricœur, Kurt Gödel, John Paul II, Rudolf Carnap, Jacques Derrida, Leszek Kołakowski, José Ortega y Gasset, Eugen Fink, Hans Blumenberg, Bernard Stiegler, Ludwig Landgrebe, Marvin Farber, Jan Patočka, Dallas Willard, Shaun Gallagher, Dan Zahavi, Hans Köchler, Hermann Weyl, Gabriel Marcel, Gilbert Ryle Edmund Husserl, ''Logical Investigations (Husserl)
notable_ideas: Phenomenology, ''epoché'' (also bracketing, transcendental reduction, or phenomenological reduction), natural standpoint, noema, noesis, hyletic data   eidetic reduction, phenomenological reduction, retention and protention, ''Lebenswelt'' (life world),, pre-reflective self-consciousness,   transcendental subjectivism, criticism of "physicalist objectivism," auth
